sentences.sentence: The Wolf( 狼 ) and the Dog
A wolf( 狼 ) met a big, well-fed( 肥胖的 ) dog with a heavy chain( 锁链 ) around his neck.
He asked him who fed( 喂养 ) him so well and yet made him carry that heavy chain( 锁链 ) around everywhere.
“The master( 主人 ),” he replied.
Then the wolf( 狼 ) said, “May no friend of mine ever be in such a situation.
The weight of that chain( 锁链 ) is enough to make me lose my appetite( 胃口 ).”
MORAL: There is no joy( 乐趣 ) in life without freedom.
The Wolf( 狼 ) and the Lamb( 羊羔 )
A wolf( 狼 ) met a lamb( 羔羊 ), and instead of just eating it, tried to find good reasons why he had the right to kill it.
He said, “Last year you were rude( 无礼的 ) to me.”
“No,” said the lamb( 羊羔 ) in a sad voice, “I was not born then.”
Then the wolf( 狼 ) said, “You eat grass in my land.”
“No, sir,” replied the lamb( 羊羔 ), “I have not yet eaten grass.”
Again said the wolf( 狼 ), “You drink from my river.”
“No,” said the lamb( 羊羔 ), “I have never drunk water, as my mother’s milk is both food and drink for me.”
Then the wolf( 狼 ) grabbed( 抓住 ) him and ate him up, saying,
“Even if you are right, I still won’t go hungry.”
MORAL: An evil( 邪恶的 ) person will always find an excuse for his evil( 邪恶的 ) actions.
The Wolf( 狼 ) and the Lion
A wolf( 狼 ) had stolen a lamb( 羊羔 ), and was carrying him off to his home.
A lion met him in the path( 小路 ) and took the lamb( 羊羔 ) from him.
Standing at a safe distance, the wolf( 狼 ) said, “That’s not fair! You have taken what belongs to( 属于 ) me!”
To which the lion replied,
“Oh, does this lamb( 羊羔 ) really belong to( 属于 ) you? What was it—a gift from a good friend?”
MORAL: Those who take by force will be robbed( 被抢夺 ) by force in their turn.
The Wolf( 狼 ) and the Shepherds( 牧羊人 )
A wolf( 狼 ) passing by( 经过 ) saw some shepherds( 牧羊人 ) eating a sheep for their dinner.
Walking closer to them, he said, “If I did what you are doing, you would be really angry.”
MORAL: Men easily criticize( 指责 ) things they practice themselves.
The Wolf( 狼 ) in Sheep’s Clothing
A wolf( 狼 ) decided to disguise( 伪装 ) himself so that he might catch and kill sheep without being caught by the shepherd( 牧羊人 ).
So he put on a sheepskin( 羊皮 ), and hid among the sheep when they were out in the field.
He completely fooled( 欺骗 ) the shepherd( 牧羊人 ), and when the sheep were brought home for the night he was shut in with the rest.
But that night the shepherd( 牧羊人 ), wanting some meat for his dinner, caught the wolf( 狼 ) thinking he was a sheep, and killed him with his knife on the spot( 当场 ).
MORAL: He who lives another's life may die another’s death.

question.cn: 在故事The Wolf and the Dog中，谁喂养狗并让狗戴上一条很重的锁链？
question.en: In the story The Wolf and the Dog, who fed the dog and made him carry a heavy chain?

analysis: 文中提到：“He asked him who fed him so well and yet made him carry that heavy chain around everywhere. ‘he master,’he replied. ”当狼问狗谁把他喂的这么肥，又给他戴上锁链的时候，狗回答道“主人”，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Wolf and the Lamb中，羊羔去年有没有对狼无礼？
question.en: In the story The Wolf and the Lamb, was the lamb rude to the wolf last year?

analysis: 文中提到：“The wolf said, ‘Last year you were rude to me.’‘No,’ said the lamb in a sad voice, ‘I was not born then.’” 可知去年羊羔并未出生，所以不可能对狼无礼，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Wolf and the Lion中，最后谁得到了羊羔？
question.en: In the story The Wolf and the Lion, who got the lamb at last?

analysis: 文中提到：“A lion met him in the path and took the lamb from him.”故事后面狼也没有把羊抢回来，所以最后是狮子得到了羊，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Wolf and the Shepherds中，当狼经过的时候，牧羊人在干什么？
question.en: In the story The Wolf and the Shepherds, what were the shepherds doing when the wolf passed by?

analysis: 文中提到：“A wolf passing by saw some shepherds eating a sheep for their dinner.”可见，狼经过的时候，牧羊人正在吃饭，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Wolf in Sheep’s Clothing中，牧羊人为什么会杀掉伪装的狼？
question.en: In the story The Wolf in Sheep’s Clothing, why did the shepherd kill the disguised wolf?

options.cn: 牧羊人把狼当作羊杀掉了。
options.en: The shepherd thought the wolf was a sheep.

options.cn: 牧羊人很生气狼欺骗了他。
options.en: The shepherd was angry that the wolf fooled him.

analysis: 文中提到：“But that night the shepherd, wanting some meat for his dinner, caught the wolf thinking he was a sheep, and killed him with his knife on the spot.”牧羊人晚上想吃一些肉，就把狼当成羊杀了，因此选A。
